title: The Week of Walter Price: From Teacher to Hero

story.text: Walter Price, a passionate 32-year-old teacher, begins his week typically, teaching history at the local high school and sharing life advice with his students.
While heading to a coffee shop, Walter intervenes in a street altercation, discovering his ability to calm conflicts with his voice alone.
Curious about his newfound power, Walter tests it on small disputes among neighbors and colleagues, successfully mediating without fail.
Feeling emboldened, Walter stops a bank robbery by conversing with the criminals, leading them to surrender peacefully to the police.
News of Walter's heroic deeds spread throughout the city. Media dub him 'The Peacemaker' as he continues to resolve conflicts.
Walter holds a community workshop on conflict resolution, using his experience to empower others to solve their disagreements amicably.
Reflecting on his week, Walter realizes that his teaching skills and advising are just as heroic, vowing to use both in his dual life as a superhero.

ending: And so, Walter Price embraced his role as both a teacher and a hero, using his voice as his mightiest tool.
moral: Everyday skills, when applied with courage and kindness, can make anyone a hero.
